question_sentence: On Monday, Apple became the first U.S. business to be valued at how much?
The College Football National Championship Game will feature a rematch of a game played earlier this year. Which two teams will play again?
Verizon and AT&T delayed the rollout of 5G after the airline industry’s concerns that the service could interfere with systems on planes.
Which of these discontinued sodas made a comeback this week?
A winter storm left drivers stranded overnight, some for 24 hours, on I-95. In which state did the traffic jam happen?
All of the following products were introduced in this year’s Consumer Electronics Show except:
choices: Tech that lets cars change colors with the press of a button
A tub that lets you preset a bath’s temperature using voice command
A collar that translates dogs’ barks
A robot toy that nibbles you

question_sentence: Thursday marks one year since the Jan. 6 Capitol riot. Which state leads with the most arrests so far in the insurrection?
What are people calling dual infections of COVID-19 and the flu?
The #BettyWhiteChallenge has been trending on social media after the beloved actress died. How do people participate?
choices: By saying “thank you for being a friend” to all their friends
By doing 100 push-ups on what would’ve been her 100th birthday
By donating to an animal shelter because she loved animals

question_sentence: Novak Djokovic has been denied entry into Australia because:
choices: He didn’t provide correct documentation for a COVID-19 vaccine exemption
He tested positive for COVID-19 this week
He did not pass a drug test

question_sentence: Twitter banned which popular news service from the social media platform for allegedly violating audience manipulation rules?
evidence: A Twitter spokesperson said the controversial news aggregator, which had more than 400,000 followers, was banned after violating rules on ‘platform manipulation and spam’

question_sentence: Donald Trump cancelled a press conference at which location that was scheduled to take place on the first anniversary of the Capitol riot?
choices: Trump National Golf Club Los Angeles
Trump Park Avenue, New York City
evidence: Sources told The New York Times that the former president axed the event amid fears that it ‘would not likely receive the kind of blanket cable coverage that he generally desires’

question_sentence: What is the name of the Kazakh president who requested assistance from a Russian-led military alliance to stem protests in his country?
evidence: The Moscow-led Collective Security Treaty Organization was deployed to Kazakhstan after protests over fuel prices turned into anti-government riots in the former Soviet nation

question_sentence: Elizabeth Holmes was found guilty of overseeing fraudulent business practices at which company that she founded in 2003?
evidence: The former CEO is facing up to 20 years in prison after being convicted of defrauding investors, following a three-month trial in California

question_sentence: Apple became that first company in history to surpass what valuation?
evidence: The tech giant hit the milestone valuation on the first day of trading in 2022

question_sentence: Which town has been voted the worst place to live in the UK in the latest annual poll by satirical website iLiveHere?
evidence: The market town in Buckinghamshire scored more than 25% more votes than runner-up Huddersfield in the online poll of 110,000 people

question_sentence: Cannabis would effectively be decriminalised in how many London boroughs under a planned new pilot scheme?
evidence: London Mayor Sadiq Khan is spearheading plans to tell police in Lewisham, Bexley and Greenwich ‘not to arrest young people caught with cannabis, ketamine or speed’, The Telegraph reported

question_sentence: The US Treasury slapped sanctions on which Bosnian Serb leader for ‘significant corruption and destabilising activities’?
evidence: The assets freeze and visa ban were imposed after Dodik threatened to withdraw Republika Srpska from state institutions including the army, the judiciary and the tax system

question_sentence: A shopper was left scratching his head after being asked for ID to prove he was over 18 in order to buy which product in Tesco?
evidence: A tech error meant the supermarket accidently listed a saucisson sec, a dry-cured pork product, as secateurs, a bladed gardening tool

question_sentence: Boris Johnson is facing a fresh sleaze scandal over his apparent support for proposals to rehash which 19th century spectacle?
evidence: The PM reportedly promised to consider plans for a ‘great exhibition’ backed by a Tory donor who helped fund his Downing Street flat refurbishment

question_sentence: The prime minister of this country resigned this week as violence and unrest persist following a military takeover of the country’s government last October.
evidence: Abdalla Hamdok served as prime minister of Sudan. Violence between civilian protesters and military groups has cost dozens of lives since October’s coup.

question_sentence: Which iconic piece of technology is now fully defunct after the company announced it will no longer support its software?
evidence: BlackBerry stopped running support for all devices using its proprietary BlackBerry OS software, the latest version of which was launched in 2013.

question_sentence: Elizabeth Holmes has been found guilty on four charges of defrauding investors during her time as the CEO of Theranos. What was the focus behind her now-defunct Silicon Valley startup?
evidence: Holmes claimed Theranos had the capability to accurately and reliably test for a range of conditions using just a few drops of blood taken from a finger prick.

question_sentence: The US observed the first anniversary of the January 6 Capitol insurrection this week. About how many people have been arrested for their roles in the attack as part of the Justice Department’s ongoing investigation?
evidence: About 700 people have been arrested so far, and hundreds more are at large. The investigation is the largest one ever taken on by the FBI.

question_sentence: Which car company just unveiled the EQXX, an electric concept vehicle that the company claims can drive 620 miles on a single charge?
evidence: Mercedes unveiled the EQXX, which, if its computer models prove true, will have a much farther range than any other electric vehicle currently available in the US.

question_sentence: How many Americans were estimated to have voluntarily left their jobs in November of 2021, continuing the high rates of the “great resignation” era?
evidence: It’s estimated that 4.5 million Americans quit their jobs in November, a figure matching September resignations, according to new data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

question_sentence: What caused hundreds of motorists to be stranded – in some cases for more than 24 hours – along a 50-mile stretch of interstate in Virginia?
evidence: Heavy snowfall caused motorists to be stranded along a 50-mile stretch of I-95 in Virginia. State and federal officials had to remove dozens of stranded vehicles, aid disabled trucks and plow snow-covered stretches to relieve the congestion.

question_sentence: Which city’s NFL team is getting a new name in February?
evidence: The Washington Football team, which changed their name from the Redskins in 2020, will be getting an official new name at the beginning of February.

question_sentence: What unique animal did demonstrators bring to the steps of Chile’s presidential palace as a form of protest?
evidence: The Chilean demonstrators, specifically beekeepers, brought an estimated 10,000 bees as a form of protest against the government’s response to a struggling honey industry. Seven police officers were reportedly stung during the demonstration.

question_sentence: AT&T and Verizon are rolling out new 5G infrastructure, but will delay the activation of the technology at what specific location?
evidence: The companies have agreed to a two-week delay on activating the technology near airports at the request of the Department of Transportation and the FAA. Some in the aviation industry fear the technology will disrupt aircraft electronics and other aspects of airline travel.
